body: I want use GL3 build osg, added a line of set(osg_OPENGL_PROFILE "GL3") to the x64-windows.cmake file. And then there's this problem

I reinstalled VS2022 and installed the latest MSVC 14.39.33519, but I still got an error，It seems that min\max and std:: min () and std:: max () are conflicts defined by Visual C ++. I don't know how to solve them
Some configuration seem to include `windows.h` before or without defining `NOMINMAX`.

I added `-DNOMINMAX=ON` at `vcpkg_cmake_configure(OPTIONS) `in vcpkg\ports\osg\portfile.cmake , like this
`vcpkg_cmake_configure(
SOURCE_PATH "${SOURCE_PATH}"
OPTIONS
${FEATURE_OPTIONS}
-DNOMINMAX=ON`
And add `add_definitions(-DNOMINMAX)` to vcpkg\buildtrees\osg\src\raph-3.6.5-c3f8c61ada.clean\CMakeLists.txt .
Not sure which one worked, but osg is installed!

> I added `-DNOMINMAX=ON` at `vcpkg_cmake_configure(OPTIONS) `in vcpkg\ports\osg\portfile.cmake , like this `vcpkg_cmake_configure( SOURCE_PATH "${SOURCE_PATH}" OPTIONS ${FEATURE_OPTIONS} -DNOMINMAX=ON` And add `add_definitions(-DNOMINMAX)` to vcpkg\buildtrees\osg\src\raph-3.6.5-c3f8c61ada.clean\CMakeLists.txt . Not sure which one worked, but osg is installed!

~I don't believe this is the fix. It must be passed to the compiler (preprocessor macro), not to cmake (option).~  
`add_definitions` is the key.

In fact, I changed the portfile.cmake configuration to run vcpkg install osg，then   add 'add_definitions(-DNOMINMAX)' to vcpkg\buildtrees\osg\src\raph-3.6.5-c3f8c61ada.clean\CMakeLists.txt .
Probably made it work by changing the CMakeLists before it started building, which I know is not a good idea, but haven't figured out a better way

issue.title: [osg] Enable macro NOMINMAX on windows

labels.name: category:port-bug
labels.description: The issue is with a library, which is something the port should already support

labels.name: info:needs-maintainer-attention
labels.description: Lets the current 'on rotation' vcpkg maintainer know they need to look at this.

repository.name: vcpkg
repository.description: C++ Library Manager for Windows, Linux, and MacOS

issue.body:
Fixes #38688
- [x] Changes comply with the [maintainer guide](https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg-docs/blob/main/vcpkg/contributing/maintainer-guide.md).
- [ ] ~~SHA512s are updated for each updated download.~~
- [ ] ~~The "supports" clause reflects platforms that may be fixed by this new version.~~
- [ ] ~~Any fixed [CI baseline](https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/blob/master/scripts/ci.baseline.txt) entries are removed from that file.~~
- [ ] ~~Any patches that are no longer applied are deleted from the port's directory.~~
- [x] The version database is fixed by rerunning `./vcpkg x-add-version --all` and committing the result.
- [x] Only one version is added to each modified port's versions file.

body:
> In fact, I changed the portfile.cmake configuration to run vcpkg install osg，then add 'add_definitions(-DNOMINMAX)' to vcpkg\buildtrees\osg\src\raph-3.6.5-c3f8c61ada.clean\CMakeLists.txt . Probably made it work by changing the CMakeLists before it started building, which I know is not a good idea, but haven't figured out a better way

@gfyrtuwcv I created a patch to enable macro `NOMINMAX` on Windows. Since I couldn't reproduce the issue locally, could you test the PR #38780 to see if it resolves your problem?

> @gfyrtuwcv I created a patch to enable macro `NOMINMAX` on Windows. Since I couldn't reproduce the issue locally, could you test the PR #38780 to see if it resolves your problem?

Yes, successfully solved! Thank you

issue.title: [osg] build failure on x64-linux

labels.name: requires:repro
labels.description: The issue is not currently repro-able

repository.name: vcpkg
repository.description: C++ Library Manager for Windows, Linux, and MacOS

issue.body:
### Operating system

Linux

### Compiler

GCC

### Steps to reproduce the behavior

```Shell
` vcpkg install osg `
```

### Failure logs

```
Detecting compiler hash for triplet x64-linux...
Compiler found: /usr/bin/c++

-- Extracting source /opt/vcpkg/downloads/openscenegraph-OpenSceneGraph-OpenSceneGraph-3.6.5.tar.gz

```

### Additional context

This is a duplication of 
#38688
https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/issues/38688 : the bug is on window machine 
so to fix or overcome this in linux machine


i have tried

- reinstalling the vcpkg 
- vcpkg upgrade
